content.text: The app is functional, but I'd like to make small UI updates to the registration and login pages. Specifically, the fields should display: — Username or Email — Password"
The app is functional, but I'd like to make small UI updates to the registration and login pages. Specifically, the fields should display: — Username or Email — Password"
I'll help you update the UI for the registration and login pages to display "Username or Email" and "Password" as field labels. Let me first explore the project structure to find the template files.
Now let me search for the registration and login template files:
Perfect! Now let me examine the current registration and login template files to see their current structure:
Now I'll update all four template files to change the "Username:" labels to "Username or Email:". Let me start with the registration pages:

content.lineBasedDiff:
--- C:/Users/varun/OneDrive/Desktop/21-project/HomePage/HomePage/src/main/resources/templates/Register-jobseeker.html +++ C:/Users/varun/OneDrive/Desktop/21-project/HomePage/HomePage/src/main/resources/templates/Register-jobseeker.html @@ -14,7 +14,7 @@

Register as Jobseeker

- +

--- C:/Users/varun/OneDrive/Desktop/21-project/HomePage/HomePage/src/main/resources/templates/Register-recuiter.html +++ C:/Users/varun/OneDrive/Desktop/21-project/HomePage/HomePage/src/main/resources/templates/Register-recuiter.html @@ -20,7 +20,7 @@
- +

content.text: Now I'll update the login pages:

content.lineBasedDiff:
--- C:/Users/varun/OneDrive/Desktop/21-project/HomePage/HomePage/src/main/resources/templates/LoginJobseekerPage.html +++ C:/Users/varun/OneDrive/Desktop/21-project/HomePage/HomePage/src/main/resources/templates/LoginJobseekerPage.html @@ -75,7 +75,7 @@

Job Seeker Login

- +

--- C:/Users/varun/OneDrive/Desktop/21-project/HomePage/HomePage/src/main/resources/templates/LoginRecuiterPage.html
+++ C:/Users/varun/OneDrive/Desktop/21-project/HomePage/HomePage/src/main/resources/templates/LoginRecuiterPage.html
@@ -77,7 +77,7 @@
     <form action="/login" method="post">
       <input type="hidden" name="role" value="recruiter" />
 
-      <label for="username">Username:</label>
+      <label for="username">Username or Email:</label>
       <input type="text" id="username" name="username" required />
 
       <label for="password">Password:</label>

content.text:
Perfect! I've successfully updated all the registration and login pages to display the requested field labels. Here's a summary of the changes made:

## Updated Pages:

1. **Register-jobseeker.html** - Job seeker registration page
2. **Register-recuiter.html** - Recruiter registration page  
3. **LoginJobseekerPage.html** - Job seeker login page
4. **LoginRecuiterPage.html** - Recruiter login page

## Changes Made:

- Changed all "Username:" labels to "Username or Email:"
- All "Password:" labels remain as "Password:" (as requested)

The UI updates are now complete! All registration and login forms will now display:
- **Username or Email** (instead of just "Username")
- **Password** (unchanged)

These changes are purely cosmetic and don't affect the backend functionality. The forms will still work exactly the same way, but now provide clearer labeling that indicates users can potentially enter either a username or email address in the first field.
